main event: A family witnessed a bright, pulsating object with colors in the sky over Ottawa, Ohio, on March 29, 1966.
interesting points: The witness described the object as having a humming sound and a smaller light following it., The object changed color from red to greenish-blue as it took off., The family estimated the object was about 7/8 the size of a match head at arm's length., There was concern about the lack of immediate investigation following the sighting., The document indicates that the sighting was reported to the Putnam County Sheriff shortly after it occurred.
witness description: a family, including a mature and responsible individual
